dt: {bc}a medieval short lyrical poem in a strict poetic form
{bc}a complex polyphonic unaccompanied vocal piece on a secular text developed especially in the 16th and 17th centuries

et: Italian {it}madrigale{/it}, probably from Medieval Latin {it}matricale{/it}, from neuter of {it}*matricalis{/it} simple, from Late Latin, of the womb, from Latin {it}matric-, matrix{/it} womb, from {it}mater{/it} mother
shortdef: a medieval short lyrical poem in a strict poetic form
a complex polyphonic unaccompanied vocal piece on a secular text developed especially in the 16th and 17th centuries
